title: Blackburn Rovers v Manchester United: match preview | Football | The Guardian
text:
Blackburn Rovers v Manchester United: match preview Blackburn Rovers v Manchester United: probable starters in bold, contenders in light View more sharing options Close Saturday 18 February 2017 09.00 GMT 
José Mourinho is starting to mould Manchester United into the kind of winning machine all his best sides resemble. He is intent on taking the competition seriously despite United being in the EFL Cup final, the Europa League, and vying for a top-four finish. All of this means that if beleaguered Blackburn Rovers – second bottom in the Championship and with virtually absent owners, Venky’s – can beat them it will be a bona fide upset. Jamie Jackson 
Kick-off Sunday 4.15pm 
Head to head B’burn 32 Man Utd 51 Draws 29 
Live BT Sport 2 
This season G 25, Y 96, R 1, 3.88 cards per game 
Odds H 17-2 A 2-5 D 4-1 Blackburn Rovers 
Subs from Raya, Emnes, Nyambe, Tomlinson, Brown, Gallagher, Evans, Greer, Hoban 
Doubtful Gallagher (knee) 
Suspended Akpan (first of three), Bennett (first of two) 
Form DWLDDL (all competitions) 
Discipline Y52 R3 (all competitions) 
Leading scorers Gallagher, Graham 11 (all competitions) Manchester Utd 
Subs from Pereira, Fosu-Mensah, Tuanzebe, Young, Schweinsteiger, Lingard, Mata, Blind, Romero, Martial, Valencia, Smalling, Mkhitaryan, Rooney, Carrick, Jones 
Doubtful Carrick, Rooney (both match fitness), Mkhitaryan (ill) 
Injured None
